title: Operating System Development
description: As an extra assignment I worked on a educational operating system "CourseOS". In eight weeks time I made significant progress on a scheduler with context switching. I worked closely in a self-steering team, with whom I gave a presentation for the rest of the class at the end of the quarter.

title: Delft Algorithmic Programming Contest
description: In this contest you were given a set of problems, of which you had to think of an algorithm to solve it in the time complexity.

title: Assistant Researcher
description: I am currently trying to improve the reliability connections in an untrusted DHT system. Solving my issue could cause a huge improvement in the usability of truly distributed networks.

title: HackDelft
description: In this hackathon I had created an OAuth 2.0 server following the RFC specs.

title: First-Year Programming Contest
description: This is another algorithmic programming contest I participated in. I ended in place four of the about thirty teams.

title: x86 Assembly Competition Winner
description: This was a competition to make the fastest Brainfuck interpreter in x86 assembly. I ended up making a JIT compiler, which ran Towers of Hanoi in just under 35ms. Due to the high performance, I won the competition out of 950 students.
